intro: Machaeranthera arizonica, commonly known as Arizona goldcup, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of smaller florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant is adapted to arid environments and has a long blooming period, often from late spring to early fall.
